page.title: 05Edingale Church Building
page.content: The church building is dedicated to the Holy Trinity. Little is known of the structure which existed before 1735 when the church was rebuilt of brick but a Saxon "light" was preserved in the Chancel wall. After further destruction by lightning,the present church was rebuilt on the original site in 1881. It incorporates the Saxon window in the vestry and was built in the Early English style at a cost of 1910 pounds. A clock was added in 1884 and in 1975 the tower had to be reconstructed because of gale damage. When the bells were rehung in 1981 one bell bore the date 1685. Records of christenings, marriages and funerals date from 1575 and the churchwardens accounts begin in 1811.We no longer have a vicar to ourselves but are in a joint ministry with Harleston.
